sections.heading: My Ties to Arizona
sections.body: I grew up in Arizona as a kid. My great-great-grandfather, Lot Smith, was asked by Brigham Young to help settle Sunset Valley near Mormon Lake. After he was killed, 6 months before my great-grandfather was born, he married his 9th wife, Diantha. After Lot’s death, she moved to Thatcher. Since then, for several generations, the smiths resided there.. Growing up in Arizona, we dealt with an Arid climate where we had to be conscious of water use and various desert wildlife such as rattlesnakes and scorpions, which were abundant on my family's horse ranch.

sections.heading: Interesting Physical Geography
sections.body: Describe one interesting aspect of Arizona’s physical geography (e.g., the Grand Canyon, Sonoran Desert, Colorado Plateau, Mogollon Rim, or San Francisco Peaks). Explain why it stands out.

sections.heading: Reflection: Alma 30:44
sections.quote: All things denote there is a God; yea, even the earth, and all things that are upon the face of it, yea, and its motion, yea, and also all the planets which move in their regular form do witness that there is a Supreme Creator. — Alma 30:44
sections.body: How does the Earth testify of a Supreme Being and Creator? Offer a thoughtful response that connects specific physical processes or patterns you observe in Arizona (or more broadly) with your faith and understanding of divine design, order, and stewardship.
